page.title: 10TOURISM IN MORETON
page.content: Moreton attracts{tourists}for many reasons. It is situated on the Fosse Way (A429) and is a suitable stopping place for people from the north of England going to the south coast on holiday. It is also in the {Cotswolds}which is a popular tourist attraction. Some visit Moreton because of the{Market}which is held every Tuesday. Some{foreign tourists}stay in Moreton and use it as a centre to visit places like Stratford-on-Avon (birth place of Shakespeare), Warwick Castle, the University at Oxford, Blenheim Palace at Woodstock, Sudeley Castle, or the bird reserve at Slimbridge.Some tourists come every few months from the Continent and buy{antiques}and take them back to their country and sell them at a profit.
